results.title: Rushmore
results.creator_credit: Wes Anderson, Barry Mendel, Paul Schiff, American Empirical Pictures and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Max Fisher (Jason Schwartzman) is a highly eccentric 10th grade student at Rushmore Academy whose life is altered when he meets and falls in love with the elegant Miss Cross (Olivia Williams), a recently widowed first grade teacher. Max finds himself caught in a strange love triangle when his close friend Mr. Blume (Bill Murray), a wealthy steel tycoon also falls for Miss Cross. Written by Wes Anderson and Owen Wilson, this films addresses the intricate relationships that evolve between students, teachers, friends and family. Cast also includes Seymour Cassel. Brian Cox.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wes Anderson, Barry Mendel, Paul Schiff, American Empirical Pictures and Touchstone Pictures

results.title: On a budget
results.creator_credit: Chris Farrell, Peter Lindon and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Offers families advice on how to budget and save for the future in five 10 minute programmes. This series is recommended viewing for parents with young families, and offers practical and easy to implement strategies on a wide range of issues to do with parenting.

results.title: Salt cod
results.creator_credit: Allan Wargon, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Cod fish have been caught and processed for export along the coast of Newfoundland for the past four centuries. This film traces the growth of industry and shows the present day methods of handling this harvest from the seas. At the height of seasons, fishermen and their families labour from dawn to dusk hauling in and preserving the catch. The work of splitting, salting, drying and grading is shown, and concluding reference is made to the more recent quick freeze method.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allan Wargon, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Back to work
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Explores mothers returning to the workforce. Examines issues such as the costs of returning to the workforce, reasons for returning and childcare for preschool and school age children.

results.title: Feeding
results.creator_credit: Margot Phillipson, Norman Athersmith, Chris Farrell and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Five 10 minute programs as screened on ABC television giving advice for parents on the feeding of young children. Discusses breast and bottle feeding, weaning, the introduction of solid foods and general aspects of nutrition.

results.title: Safety II
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
A large number of small children and babies are injured every year in and around the home. These 5 short episodes look at child safety in a practical way. Focuses on issues such as common, easily swallowed poisons, burns, fire-proof clothing, the dangers of electricity, devices which can be installed to prevent electrical accidents, the hazards to be found in the backyard, the safe placement of furniture and fittings in the home, pool safety and rescusitation skills in case of drowning.

results.title: Salt
results.creator_credit: Amber Goodwyn, Beverly Brown, Karen Shamy-Smith, Morgan Gage and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Four documentary ‘filmzines’, each directed by a seventeen-year-old female student assisted by a professional film crew provided by the National Film Board of Canada. The films evolved from fanzines (low-tech, independently produced niche magazines), produced by the young filmmakers that addressed issues central to their lives. Their ‘windows into youth culture’ range from alternative music and punk subculture to self-mutilation and education. ‘Salt’ stays true to its roots, using innovative digital imaging techniques to maintain the feel of the ‘zines’ that inspired its making. A comprehensive companion website to the film project can be found at http://www.nfb.ca/salt/

Episode of Series “PGR Series”.

results.title: More questions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
In this title, viewers questions cover the topics of road safety, appropriate medications, how to handle dummies, the importance of immunisation, the dangers of smoking, and Government allowances for families. PGR also gives some tips for parents whose babies have been fitted with splints. We talk to a Speech Pathologist about childhood stuttering and demonstrate suitable exercises for women recovering from a caesarean. Finally, PGR answers questions specifically concerning SIDS, and we talk to parents about the syndrome.

results.title: Children and abuse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
There are four different categories of child abuse: Neglect, Emotional Abuse, Physical Abuse and Sexual Abuse. Through parents relating personal stories of their children and their experiences with child abuse P.G.R discusses the ease of damage to young children through any of the defined forms of abuse. Ways to create a positive emotional environment for the child, how to handle potential child abuse situations, and the value of “special time” are all discussed with parents.
